description: From Middle English husting, from Old English hūsting, borrowed from Old Norse húsþing (“house assembly”), from hús (“house”) + þing (“council, meeting”), equivalent to house +‎ thing. Cognate with Icelandic húsþing (“assembly”).

entries.meaning: A platform where candidates in an election give speeches.
(historical) An assembly, especially one of the retainers of a ruler.
